p: Sun-Yuan Hsieh received the Ph.D. degree in computer science from National Taiwan University, Taipei, Taiwan, in June 1998. He then served the compulsory two-year military service. From August 2000 to January 2002, he was an assistant professor at the Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering, at National Chi Nan University. In February 2002, he joined the Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, and now he is a full professor. He received the 2007 K. T. Lee Research Award, President's Citation Award (American Biographical Institute) in 2007, the Engineering Professor Award of Chinese Institute of Engineers (Kaohsiung Branch) in 2008, and the National Science Council's Outstanding Research Award in 2009. His current research interests include design and analysis of algorithms, fault-tolerant computing, bioinformatics, parallel and distributed computing, and algorithmic graph theory.

p: Nai-Wen Chang received the BS degree from the Department of Mathematics at the National Taiwan University, Taiwan, in 2001; and the MS degree from the Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering at the National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan, in 2005. He is now a Ph.D. student in the Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan. His research interests include interconnection networks, computation theory, and graph theory.

details.abstract: We consider fault-tolerant embedding, where an n-dimensional faulty hypercube, denoted by Q n, acts as the host graph, and the longest fault-free cycle represents the guest graph. Let F v be a set of faulty nodes in Q n. Also, let F e be a set of faulty edges in which at least one end-node of each edge is faulty, and letFe be a set of faulty edges in which the end-nodes of each edge are both fault-free. An edge in Q n is said to be critical if it is either fault-free or in F e. In this paper, we prove that there exists a fault-free cycle of length at least 2n-2|F v| in Q n (n ges 3) with |F e| les 2n-5, and |F v|+|F e| les 2n-4 , in which each node is incident to at least two critical edges. Our result improves on the previously best known results reported in the literature, where only faulty nodes or faulty edges are considered.

context.text: A number of fault-tolerant embedding options for specific topologies are discussed in the literature [4]–[5][7], [9], [11]–[14], [16]–[19], [23]–[25], [27], [28].
Among them, fault-tolerant cycle-embedding in faulty hypercubes has received a great deal of attention in recent years [2], [5], [6], [8], [11], [13], [14], [20], [21], [23], [28].
Under the conditional fault model, it was shown that there exists a fault-free Hamiltonian cycle in \$Q_{n}\$ with at most \$2n-5\$ faulty edges [5], [26].
In this paper, we generalize the results in [5], [26] to consider faulty elements for fault-tolerant cycle embedding in \$Q_{n}\$.
Our result improves on the results in [5], [11], [26], which consider either faulty nodes, or faulty edges.

context.text: Under the conditional fault model, it was shown that there exists a fault-free Hamiltonian cycle in \$Q_{n}\$ with at most \$2n-5\$ faulty edges [5], [26].
In this paper, we generalize the results in [5], [26] to consider faulty elements for fault-tolerant cycle embedding in \$Q_{n}\$.
Our result improves on the results in [5], [11], [26], which consider either faulty nodes, or faulty edges.
